sentences.english: In ancient China, all the Utopias were completely agricultural ones.
sentences.chinese: 中国古代的理想国都是纯粹的农业乌托邦。

sentences.english: The core of Plato's The Republic is idealism.
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图《理想国》的理论核心是理念论。

sentences.english: In Book VII of the Republic Socrates presents the allegory as follows.
sentences.chinese: 在《理想国》第七卷，苏格拉底讲述了这个比喻。

sentences.english: Do you remember that name, Book I of the Republic?
sentences.chinese: 还记得那个名字吗，《理想国》的第一卷？

sentences.english: This is why Tahiti is the ideal place to get away from it all.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么大溪地是个能让人远离尘嚣的理想国度。

sentences.english: His theory of scale in aesthetic appreciation is the soul of Utopic.
sentences.chinese: 其“审美阶梯说”则是理想国的美学核心和灵魂。

sentences.english: But this provides a kind of introduction, as it were, to the Republic.
sentences.chinese: 但它确实充当了，《理想国》的最佳引言。

sentences.english: Thrasymachus That comes straight out of Thrasymachus, Book I of the Republic.
sentences.chinese: 那直接取源自，《理想国》第一册。

sentences.english: In Plato's Republic, I'm sure he'd have had the same.
sentences.chinese: 我确信在柏拉图的理想国里也会有同样做法。

sentences.english: Spiritedness is the central, psychological quality of the Republic.
sentences.chinese: 意志是《理想国》的核心，与精神质量。

sentences.english: The Republic, like the Greek polis, was a kind of tutelary association.
sentences.chinese: 理想国》类似希腊城邦，一种守护式的联合。

sentences.english: The Republic is a very perplexing book, you will find out.
sentences.chinese: 理想国》是本费解的巨著，你会慢慢了解到。
